page.title: 16Paddlesworth
page.content: Paddlesworth is part of an ancient settlement with a Georgian manor house and a small Norman Church still remaining.During the middle ages St. Benedict's Church belonged to a manor which was owned by Odo,Bishop of Bayeux. The Black Death in the fourteenth century killed many of the population. In 1678 the Church was closed as a religious building.It was used mainly as a barn for the next 250 years.Then in the 1930's the Roberts Family of Paddlesworth Farm restored the Church. Since 1971 it has been redundant as a church but open to visitors. The Church is 45 feet long,17 feet high and 17 feet wide.The walls are mainly built of flint rubble,patches of brick and ragstone.The chancel arch is decorated with fourteenth century carved heads.
